intro: Metrosideros collina f. strigosa, commonly known as the silver-leafed Christmas bush, is a variant of the Christmas bush native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its dense, silvery-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a leathery texture. It produces small, red flowers that bloom in clusters, often around Christmas time, hence its common name. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal and sunny environments.
